main event: A witness, a civilian aged 55 from Bryte, California, observed a flat oval-shaped, bright orange object with red across the center in the eastern sky on August 16, 1965.
interesting points: The object was observed for approximately 15 to 17 minutes and appeared to gradually disappear toward the ground., The object was described as being about the size of a dime and extraordinarily bright., The witness used binoculars to observe the object and noted no sound emitted., The sighting occurred at night under slightly overcast conditions., The object's movement included standing still for 8 to 10 minutes before moving slowly from east to west.
sighted object: a flat oval-shaped bright orange object with red across the center
witness description: One witness is a civilian aged 55 from the Division of Forestry; the other is a pilot.
